42085A91811B434DBE0F1CBA0A44E57D.description: Take responsibility for helping to put equipment away and treating equipment respectfully.

7375C21ECFD94542B4B40FFB8D15D587.description: Create simple rules for play and share these rules with others.

F2788FA619DD4A51A0905EF63BA161CA.description: Follow the rules of play while participating in a variety of simple cooperative movement activities and lead-up games.

A3109E1C21E84593877783FA4A54B099.description: Explore movement using various types of equipment safely (e.g., scooters, hoops, climbing apparatus).

31AADA2F339D4A74B643FD0098C15CB1.description: Practise accepting feelings and demonstrating acceptable behaviours associated with losing.

F32FD4A5E05341C3B94A3E7A31FC1794.description: Show respect for nature when participating in outdoor physical movement activities.

927B42A3E0B14E73B48783606B1AA2B9.description: Share thoughts on cheating (e.g., “What does cheating look like when we play games?”; “Why do you think people cheat when playing games?”; and “Is it wrong to cheat?”).

566EFFAA9A004792A8EDCA2A8B6BA84A.description: Persist in trying even when it gets hard to do so (as long as it does not hurt).

DE41AD4B842B4BCDAE84F92529A1669B.description: Engage in play with a variety of classmates, including those who are friends or not friends.

4B6037CF81FC428697A914A18EC00378.description: Recognize that it is okay to continue participating when tired or to take a break when feeling pain.

7EB825C990CE4BB289301AAC15F968F1.description: Repeat and practise safety rules related to movement in physical activity setting (e.g., make sure that balls are not left rolling around where someone else can step on them, do not throw balls at other people, keep head up and look around when moving).

ECA70DA092A04A239DF2DD8610C1B525.description: Discuss and practise ways to solve problems when moving among other people (e.g., say excuse me, take turns when appropriate).

B7FF497DEF5A4BEB8F8534D561FFFB90.description: Describe what it means to be aware of other people and the environment when moving through space to support safety of self and others.

B5F2FA4738C34FCEAA0B935359EA7556.description: Practise sharing an object (e.g., ball) and space with one other person.

0CFD413B145D4643A5434BF27014AF77.description: Practise being both the leader and follower in a variety of physical movement activities.

217DF0C8D1AE4B86AB90838C09CAA136.description: Relationships Use respectful behaviours and safe practices while participating in cooperative games and physical movement activities.

16F8CE1164414038AB1DEA5FB4E4D8B5.description: Create and share simple movement sequences or movement stories (e.g., the squirrel jumps out of the tree, scurries through the grass, and shakes while hiding in a big, hollow log).

6B7C157B6E39400C996C45AEDCAF8EC4.description: Lead others in rhythmical movement, both while remaining in personal space and while moving through general space.

738589A5B4C547CB9161D98501BB8B11.description: Follow rhythmical movements led by others.

83C7CD55E8CA43078C4DC8E47CCF3B43.description: Move body in time to the beat of the music while keeping feet in one spot and remaining balanced (e.g., move arms only, move hips only, bend up and down at the knees).

7DE29942601D460BB4C73858315777C3.description: Move to music adjusting the speed of movement in time to the rhythm of the music and the intensity of the sound.

21DA56E505654CCD86932143C0BF732C.description: Move in personal space and through general space to the beat of a drum and to clapped patterns, using a variety of movement skills (e.g., walking, running), movement efforts (e.g., quickly, slowly, lightly, heavily), and movement relationships (e.g., ‘tall’ body, ‘small’ body, ‘wiggly’ body).

529F5AE605DB425E91F44BD4023F1B9B.description: Rhythmical Movement - Explore and perform rhythmical movement to different auditory (e.g., beat of a drum, clapping, music) rhythms (e.g., quick, slow) using a variety of locomotor movements including walking, running, balancing, jumping, galloping, hopping, and skipping skills.

DA47F48B5AB846CCB472F9BA0E64F2D6.description: Practise freezing any movement when signalled to do so.

40BC96640ED4424195995DD9E0386019.description: Move over, under, around, behind, in front of, on, and off a variety of objects.

AA36495B0B134BFA85AACBAC99EB38B9.description: Move in personal space and general space on various body parts (e.g., “move body parts as fast as you can while remaining seated in your personal space”; “move across the floor while remaining seated”; and “move across the floor on your hands and feet”).

FF75FD3594D04E8D815B2B6608F8BD1F.description: Respond physically and correctly to instructions that vary the direction, levels, pathways, and effort of the body movement (e.g., walk backward slowly and lightly, move on hands and feet keeping body as low to the ground as possible).

0F9428829BE74A2093B508B320E42680.description: Move from one point to another, through moving classmates, trying not to contact anyone else.

4071300EED8949F7A29290415CB7850C.description: Create and perform movements, in sequence of at least two phrases, to represent images (e.g., riding a horse quickly, slowly; climbing a fence then balancing on a plank over some water; walking like a robot then stretching the body high to the sky while moving forward).

695FECF387DE409BB227B260E4C060EE.description: Recognize and respond to movement vocabulary (e.g., personal space, general space, balance, high, zig-zag).

A37F391FD2954C3787E4216F616DB084.description: Move the body through space following given directions (e.g., “stay in personal space and stretch your body as big as you can; now make your body as small as you can”, “move through general space on hands and feet staying low to the floor – move forward, backward, sideways”).

46C05600A52C4B808C5A080971767AC1.description: Movement Variables - Vary, with guidance, the movement of the body through changes in: space (personal space, general space, levels, directions, and pathways), effort (time and speed), relationships (body parts and shapes).

4A5E685445A9490B9D01B1FBD500165F.description: Use a variety of manipulative skills when playing simple cooperative movement activities and games.

3D3A4AB7132C4F77A7857BEED7D7F3C1.description: Share discoveries of how the movement of an object changes when the skill is performed differently (e.g., kick a ball with the toes, and then kick it with the inside of the foot; throw a ball with the arm moving closer to the body and then with the arm moving far away from the body).

646A5F99924C4EE695FE48E6F0CB8DFB.description: Explore sending objects (e.g., balloons, balls of various sizes) using various body parts such as arms, legs, and head.

7F03C035E53E40DC9189E7931296B632.description: Explore and discuss ways to approach and kick a stationary ball forward, using each foot separately.

EEA9EB4136D64CE39E802B0E787D0436.description: Explore and describe what happens when a ball is contacted with different parts of the foot when trying to kick it.

11B33BB46B0643AE8528FEC2133CFAEB.description: Practise kicking a stationary ball forward while in a stationary position, using each foot separately.

51DB78B2FD994D62AE72164EB0516312.description: Practise kicking beanbags and a variety of balls, using each foot.

3DC71EAB0F5945EF927716567BCC0207.description: Practise trapping and gathering (stopping with hands or feet, and picking up with hands) balls that are rolling on the ground using one hand, two hands, and one foot and two hands

F84B2D5B27FC4437AE26688DA2577EE0.description: Drop and try to catch a ball using each hand separately and both hands together.

190481E22072438791BA3D1EC6A9481E.description: Repeat performance words (e.g., “look at the ball”, “step forward”) to demonstrate the use of performance cues language related to send and receive objects.

36656EF78EC947379F66EC2DA6798B73.description: Explore throwing and catching one or more scarves, underhand and overhand, using each hand separately and both hands together.

53E74AA5B91D4689893C5EF481BF6481.description: Explore and share ideas about how to throw and catch (gather) a variety of objects, including balls, bean bags, scarves, and balloons, both overhand and underhand, using each hand separately and both hands together.

74D758334AB74ACDB451F1B714D447FE.description: Explore and share ways to send (throw and roll) a variety of small balls and bean bags at targets (that the ball will not bounce off) from close distances, using each hand separately and both hands together

721262AF6D7143B8AE4926600135214E.description: Explore and share ways to send (throw and roll) a small soft object (e.g., yarn ball, hackey-sack, beanbag) at a wall, and over and under objects (e.g., a chair, a bench), varying distance from the fall or object, using two hands, and using each hand separately

1FC1A8D252E04B1485D6D5B687EC8E22.description: Manipulative Skills - Explore and practise ways to send and receive objects at an exploration level when: throwing (rolling), catching (trapping, gathering) and kicking.

23596A57E12944B7B011C98930310A3C.description: Use a variety of non-locomotor skills when playing simple cooperative movement activities and games.

91C1BD5306C84818B32E064F7099735D.description: Practise trying to maintain balance on two feet, close together, shoulder width apart, and wide apart, when signalled to do so after moving on the spot (e.g., wiggling, twisting).

0255D0B806B4478189EE15957A9B4C41.description: Practise balancing in different body shapes, both self-created and given (e.g., balance creating a wide body shape; balance being as narrow as you can; balance in a twisted body shape).

C57066092FA54C98BA85A667B3FF0106.description: Create and share various ways to ‘freeze’ (balance) on the spot.

D1DA4A27636D4B29BC5464AACBFB5FEF.description: Practise jumping straight up and try to touch imaginary objects that are high in the sky and then try to land without falling down.

8AE00DC06D73424C8E384F7401103EE8.description: Practise jumping straight up and land following given instructions (e.g., jump off two feet and land on two feet).

41823A07E7F3415E84F84AB2B55E1732.description: Explore shifting (transferring) weight from one foot to the other, trying to stay in control (in balance).

BA20F22E54134FC6B883CA2231F22ED1.description: Explore and discuss what it means to jump straight up and land in control (e.g., ‘motor-cycle riding’ position).

A9784ED0A5514D6E8CAD90527AEF86AC.description: Repeat performance words (e.g., “reach arms forward”, “bend knees to soften landing”) to demonstrate the use of performance cues language related to non-locomotor skills.

171DB28746704F19A78BCEB04D78667C.description: Non-locomotor Movement - Explore and practise ways to move the body in personal space at a progressingtowards-control level of skill when: balancing, jumping and landing (on the spot).

E1136BE6AD8442369169023FD973D38E.description: Use a variety of locomotor skills when playing simple co-operative movement activities and games.

B17BC7EB7DA0440BAA4FBE4D1E1CD142.description: Move between objects (e.g., ropes laid out to create pathways) and through obstacle courses using a variety of locomotor skills.

91EB322ACA4843A88947F200D8936AF8.description: Travel as instructed (e.g., walking quickly forward, leap from right foot to left foot, slide on a line) on signal, and try to stop smoothly on signal.

BC2F265BBDDB49848C4D5D8743464A90.description: Explore ways to vary locomotor skills and share with others (e.g., “How can you move across the gym quickly?”; “What might you look like if you were moving like a horse?”).

F0B8A5A012D44E4CB8C05200B9B86453.description: Repeat performance words (e.g., “arms close to side”, “knees bend a little bit”) to demonstrate use of performance cues language related to locomotor skills

F2E3B886573740BE9EAE277DDC876BA8.description: Imitate the locomotor movements of others (e.g., copy actions made by others, follow-the-leader).

DA6FAFA2332146FB9A6947E51AD722F7.description: Respond physically to verbal prompts of travelling skill named by others (e.g., hop, leap, jump).

BEE8B9E9484541DE908B6550BE64AE29.description: Explore moving in response to locomotor vocabulary (e.g., hop, leap, slide, jump, skip, sneak, tiptoe, dash).

2D0EF5E67689455DB4A6081550AD4297.description: Explore and share ways to move the body through space (e.g., crawl slowly, hop quickly, run sneakily like a weasel, pounce like a cat, leap like a ballerina, gallop like a horse).

72B9D71EE94345068FF8AE46A5AA2F2E.description: Locomotor Movement - Explore and practise ways to move the body through space, including at: a progressing-towardcontrol level of skill when: walking, running, jumping forward and sideways, an exploration level when: hopping (body moves on one foot as in right foot to right foot), skipping (combines a step and a hop), leaping (body ‘takes off’ from one foot, propels through air for distance, then lands on the opposite foot), sliding (one foot steps and the other moves to meet the first foot, “step-close”) • galloping (one foot steps, body propels upward, other foot moves to meet the first foot)

29B1BA75593C49A3BB44F1E9E00F80C1.description: Create and share body shapes and movements that challenge the body to be ‘strong’, to ‘keep going’, and to be ‘stretchy’.

15628FD47D8047BF9F491C693F3D7898.description: Create body shapes, as prompted by the teacher, to support the development of muscular strength, muscular endurance, and flexibility (e.g., stand as tall as a giant and reach to the sky, stand on one foot for as long as you can).

80CE318281CF427AB700D435C6D6DB3E.description: Participate in teacher-led movements that stretch or strengthen muscles (e.g., teacher-led yoga poses, teacher-led stretches).

857852FE08814F688C25F2524EDD302E.description: Participate in a variety of movements that challenge muscular endurance (e.g., animal walks, climbing on/under apparatus and playground equipment, pulling partner riding on a towel or scooter, rhythmical activities, balances).

414FD8E0877245E5B88A35FAD978EF8C.description: Communicate an understanding of the fact that all people have physical responses to participation in movement activities and that these responses are good and support well-being if they do not cause pain (e.g., faster heart beat, increased perspiration, faster breathing, increased body warmth).

7F137F5C14544B239B5DEE531EDBE656.description: Recognize that physical movement is good for personal wellbeing.

BA77BFB064184276A2A848F1084ED8FA.description: Describe what the body feels like when it has participated in moderate activity and in vigorous activity

B983701EB79E43AF974242555993157F.description: Participate in moderate to vigorous locomotor movements (e.g., walking, running) and a variety of movement activities (e.g., individual activities, partner activities, rhythmic activities, loworganizational and co-operative games, and alternate environment activities), progressing towards sustaining movement for four consecutive minutes

AD2DF4D4514046CB9CDB190D83058155.description: Fitness - Participate in a variety of moderate to vigorous movement activities for short periods of time to increase heart and respiration rate, flexibility, muscular endurance, and muscular strength.
